prompt: <description>Part 1 Construct a cylindrical object with a rectangular opening on one side. Extrude the sketch with a depth of 0.075 towards the normal and 0.075 in the opposite direction, and scale the sketch by a factor of 0.225. Part 2 Construct a rectangular metal bracket with two holes on opposite sides. Start by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles (0, 0, 0) and a translation vector of (0, 0, 0.15). For the sketch, construct face 1: - Loop 1: - Line 1: Start Point (0.0119, 0), End Point (0.3128, 0) - Arc 1: Start Point (0.3128, 0), Mid Point (0.2625, 0.0938), End Point (0.3128, 0.1875) - Line 2: Start Point (0.3128, 0.1875), End Point (0.0119, 0.1875) - Arc 2: Start Point (0.0119, 0.1875), Mid Point (0, 0.0938), End Point (0.0119, 0) Loop 1 forms the outer rectangle of the bracket. For Loop 2 in Face 1, create a circle with Center (0.105, 0.0937) and Radius (0.0365). This forms a hole in the bracket. Construct face 2 and face 3 by duplicating face 1 with different holes. Make sure the faces share edges and vertices. Extrude the sketches of each face by 0.075 in the opposite direction of the normal. The height of part 1 is 0.15, and the height of part 2 is 0.075. The final shape has a height of 1.25. The width and length of part 1 are both 0.225. The width of the rectangular opening is approximately 0.5, and the length of part 1 is also approximately 0.5. The width and length of part 2 are 0.75. The distances between the two holes in the bracket are approximately 0.25 and 0.45, respectively. The final shape has dimensions of approximately 4 x 2 x 1.25. The cylindrical hole has a diameter of about 0.5 units.</description>
